alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:41AM EDT until October 02 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... Manatee River At Rye Bridge affecting Manatee County. Manatee River Near Myakka Head at SR 64 affecting Manatee County. Alafia River At Lithia affecting Hillsborough County. Alafia River At Riverview near US 301 affecting Hillsborough County. Little Manatee River At Wimauma at US 301 affecting Hillsborough County. Myakka River At Myakka River State Park affecting Sarasota County. Peace River At Zolfo Springs at SR 17 affecting Hardee County. Peace River At Arcadia at SR 70 affecting DeSoto County. Peace River At Bartow affecting Polk County. Horse Creek Near Arcadia at SR 72 affecting DeSoto County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Florida... Withlacoochee At US 301 Trilby affecting Hernando and Pasco Counties. Hillsborough River Near Hillsborough River State Park affecting Hillsborough County. Cypress Creek At SR 54 Worthington Gardens affecting Pasco County. .Rain will come to end from west to east today. Rivers should begin to recede over the next couple of days. For the Alafia...including Lithia , Riverview near US 301...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Little Manatee...including Wimauma at US 301...Major flooding is forecast. For the Manatee...including Myakka Head at SR 64, Rye Bridge...Major flooding is forecast. For the Myakka...including Myakka River State Park...Major flooding is forecast. For the Peace...including Bartow, Zolfo Springs at SR 17, Arcadia at SR 70...Major flooding is forecast. For the Horse Creek...including Arcadia at SR 72...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Alafia River At Riverview near US 301. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 4.2 feet, Water begins to impact homes on Pine Avenue and Park Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 0.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage with a maximum value of 4.9 feet late tonight. - Flood stage is 4.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 4.9 feet on 06/02/2007. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (11 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Mon Tue Alafia River Riverview near US 4.2 0.9 Thu 10 am 2.1 2.5 2.5 1.3 0.4 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this morning at 1145 AM EDT.
